skill.name: azure-kusto
skill.description:
Query and analyze data in Azure Data Explorer (Kusto/ADX) using KQL for log analytics, telemetry, and time series analysis.
USE FOR: KQL queries, Kusto database queries, Azure Data Explorer, ADX clusters, log analytics, time series data, IoT telemetry, anomaly detection
DO NOT USE FOR: SQL databases (use azure-postgres), NoSQL queries (use azure-storage), Elasticsearch, AWS analytics tools
skill.summary: Query and analyze Azure Data Explorer databases using KQL for log analytics, telemetry, and time series analysis.
skill.author: microsoft

security_audit.summary: This is an official Microsoft skill for Azure Data Explorer (Kusto). Static findings are false positives: KQL query syntax (pipe operator) misinterpreted as shell commands, Azure CLI examples are legitimate API documentation, and the REST URL is a standard Azure endpoint template. No malicious patterns confirmed.

content.user_title: Query Azure Data Explorer with KQL
content.value_statement: This skill enables Claude and Codex to query Azure Data Explorer (Kusto) databases using KQL for log analytics, telemetry analysis, and time series data exploration.
actual_capabilities: Execute KQL queries against Azure Data Explorer clusters
List clusters and databases in Azure subscription
Retrieve table schemas for data exploration
Perform time series analysis and aggregation queries
Analyze log and telemetry data with Kusto Query Language
Use Azure CLI fallback for direct API queries
limitations: Requires valid Azure subscription with Kusto clusters
Query performance depends on cluster size and data volume
Does not support data modification or ingestion operations
Authentication requires Azure AD credentials with appropriate permissions

best_practices: Always filter by time range using ago() or between() to optimize query performance
Use take or limit for exploratory queries to avoid large result sets
Leverage summarize for aggregations instead of processing results client-side
anti_patterns: Avoid running queries without time filters on large tables
Do not select all columns with * when only specific fields are needed
Avoid nested joins without intermediate aggregation steps

faq.question: What is Azure Data Explorer?
faq.answer: Azure Data Explorer (also called Kusto or ADX) is a fast and scalable data exploration service optimized for log and telemetry data. It uses Kusto Query Language (KQL) for queries.

faq.question: What tools does this skill use?
faq.answer: The skill uses Azure MCP tools: kusto_cluster_list, kusto_database_list, kusto_query, and kusto_table_schema_get. It also includes Azure CLI fallback commands.

faq.question: Do I need special permissions to query Kusto?
faq.answer: Yes, you need at least Viewer role on the database. Contact your Azure administrator to request access.

faq.question: Why is my query timing out?
faq.answer: Queries may timeout on large datasets. Add time range filters, reduce result size with take, or increase the timeout setting.

faq.question: Can I insert or update data with this skill?
faq.answer: No, this skill is read-only for querying. Use Azure portal or other tools for data ingestion and modification.

faq.question: What is the difference between KQL and SQL?
faq.answer: KQL uses a pipe-based syntax (table | where condition | summarize) unlike SQL's SELECT-FROM-WHERE. KQL is optimized for time series and log data.
